data.title: Pulse Portraiture: Pulsar timing
data.name: PulsePortraiture
data.description: PulsePortraiture (PP): a wideband pulsar timing code written in python.  It uses an extension of Joe Taylor's FFTFIT algorithm (Taylor 1992) to simultaneously measure a phase (TOA) and dispersion measure (DM).  PSRCHIVE, lmfit, and the latest vertsions of numpy and scipy are required.

evidence: "A set of libraries and modules to measure 'wideband' pulse times-of-arrival (TOAs), written in python."
"The motivation behind writing this software was to develop a wideband measurement routine for high-precision pulsar timing... and it makes up a chunk of Tim Pennucci's Ph.D. thesis."

Links in README point directly to project files in the GitHub repository (e.g., `https://github.com/pennucci/PulsePortraiture/blob/master/ppspline.py`) and examples, indicating distribution via the source repository.
